name: R5-SearchModifierCode-R4-SearchModifierCode
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 SearchModifierCode into a FHIR R4 SearchModifierCode

element.display: The search parameter tests whether the value in a resource subsumes the specified value (is-a, or hierarchical relationships).

target.display: The search parameter tests whether the value in a resource subsumes the specified value (is-a, or hierarchical relationships).

element.display: The search parameter tests whether the value in a resource is subsumed by the specified value (is-a, or hierarchical relationships).

target.display: The search parameter tests whether the value in a resource is subsumed by the specified value (is-a, or hierarchical relationships).

element.display: Tests whether the textual display value in a resource (e.g., CodeableConcept.text, Coding.display, or Reference.display) matches the supplied parameter value.
The search parameter returns resources that include the supplied parameter value anywhere within the field being searched.

target.display: The search parameter returns resources that include the supplied parameter value anywhere within the field being searched.

element.display: The search parameter returns resources that have a value that exactly matches the supplied parameter (the whole string, including casing and accents).

target.display: The search parameter returns resources that have a value that exactly matches the supplied parameter (the whole string, including casing and accents).

element.display: The search parameter applies to the identifier on the resource, not the reference.

target.display: The search parameter applies to the identifier on the resource, not the reference.

element.display: The search parameter is a URI (relative or absolute) that identifies a value set, and the search parameter tests whether the coding is in the specified value set.

target.display: The search parameter is a URI (relative or absolute) that identifies a value set, and the search parameter tests whether the coding is in the specified value set.

element.display: The search parameter indicates an inclusion directive (_include, _revinclude) that is applied to an included resource instead of the matching resource.
The search parameter returns resources that have a value or not.

target.display: The search parameter returns resources that have a value or not.

element.display: The search parameter returns resources that do not contain a match.

target.display: The search parameter returns resources that do not contain a match.

element.display: The search parameter is a URI (relative or absolute) that identifies a value set, and the search parameter tests whether the coding is not in the specified value set.

target.display: The search parameter is a URI (relative or absolute) that identifies a value set, and the search parameter tests whether the coding is not in the specified value set.

element.display: The search parameter has the format system|code|value, where the system and code refer to an Identifier.type.coding.system and .code, and match if any of the type codes match. All 3 parts must be present.

target.display: The search parameter has the format system|code|value, where the system and code refer to an Identifier.type.coding.system and .code, and match if any of the type codes match. All 3 parts must be present.

element.display: The search parameter is processed as a string that searches text associated with the code/value - either CodeableConcept.text, Coding.display, Identifier.type.text, or Reference.display.

target.display: The search parameter is processed as a string that searches text associated with the code/value - either CodeableConcept.text, Coding.display, or Identifier.type.text.

element.display: Tests whether the value in a resource matches the supplied parameter value using advanced text handling that searches text associated with the code/value - e.g., CodeableConcept.text, Coding.display, or Identifier.type.text.
The search parameter only applies to the Resource Type specified as a modifier (e.g. the modifier is not actually :type, but :Patient etc.).

target.display: The search parameter only applies to the Resource Type specified as a modifier (e.g. the modifier is not actually :type, but :Patient etc.).
